General notes

  • At the top of the page is a drop-down menu with a list of projects the user has access to.
    • Within each project, there are analysis subsets or ‘assays’. Upon selecting a project, the assay dropdown menu will be populated.
  • R objects generated from RNA-Seq analysis are loaded into the app once an assay is selected.
    • This is usually the most time-intensive step and scales with the size of the analysis, e.g. the number of comparisons, performed analyses and size of genome annotation.
    • Several checks are performed at this stage to make sure the R object has the correct format and then a VST normalization is performed if the normalized data is not already present.
    • If the data is present in multiple subsets, a combined data set is created from the individual subsets.
  • The main view of the app is organized into a sidebar panel, which contains filtering and visualization controls and a main panel which displays plots and tabular data.
  • The main panel is divided into tabs to display different parts of the analysis:
    • DE analysis: interactive tables and visualizations of the differential expression (DE) analysis
    • Functional enrichment: visualization of gene ontology and KEGG pathway analyses
    • Gene patterns: visualization of gene pattern analyses
    • Help: this documentation
  • The sidebar shows global and page-specific controls that can be used to filter and adjust the plots or table output on the specific tabs

Shared controls

  • Comparison

    Dropdown menu used to select results corresponding to a specific comparison. This control is shared by the Table, MA plot, Gene plot and Heatmap tabs.

    • Note that the Comparison menu in the Functional enrichment panel is independent of this control.

  • FDR threshold, log2FC threshold

    Controls used to filter genes, shared by Summary, MA plot, Upset plot and Heatmap.

    • Note that changes here are not reflected in the Functional enrichment results as the latter are precomputed using significance thresholds set for a particular analysis.

  • Gene scratchpad

    General-purpose scratch space to make note of genes of interest from plots or tables.

    • This is accessible from most areas of the app. Genes selected here will be shown on the gene plot and labeled on the MA plot & heatmap.
    • Additional genes can be added or removed by selecting rows of the interactive DE analysis table.
    • Gene names can also be typed into this space with real-time suggestions appearing below, while comma-separated gene names can be copy-pasted here as well.
    • The Add top genes button can be used as a quick shortcut to add the top 3 up- and down-regulated genes (based on log2FoldChange) in the selected comparison.
